title: High Domestic Freshwater Usage
description: In 2021, Brunei's domestic freshwater withdrawals accounted for 164.67% of the total freshwater withdrawal, indicating a significant reliance on domestic water resources.

title: Strong National Savings Rate
description: Brunei achieved a net national savings rate of 38.38% of GNI in 2021, showcasing its robust financial health and prudent economic management.

title: High Government Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 92.34% of Brunei's current health expenditure was funded by the domestic general government, reflecting a strong commitment to public health financing.

title: Heavy Reliance on Fuel Imports
description: By 2023, fuel imports constituted 63.76% of Brunei's merchandise imports, highlighting a significant dependency on imported fuel resources.

title: Lowest Personal Remittances Received
description: In 2023, Brunei received personal remittances amounting to just 0.006% of its GDP, indicating a minimal reliance on remittances from abroad.

title: Minimal Use of Alternative and Nuclear Energy
description: As of 2022, alternative and nuclear energy accounted for only 0.01% of Brunei's total energy use, highlighting a heavy reliance on conventional energy sources.

title: Low Industrial Design Activity
description: In 2017, Brunei had only one resident industrial design application, reflecting limited innovation in industrial design.

title: Low Health Expenditure
description: Brunei's current health expenditure was 1.82% of its GDP in 2022, indicating a relatively low investment in healthcare compared to global standards.

title: Minimal Tariff Rates on Manufactured Products
description: In 2022, Brunei applied a simple mean tariff rate of 0.19% on manufactured products, one of the lowest globally, promoting trade openness.

title: Low Weighted Tariff Rates on All Products
description: The weighted mean tariff rate for all products in Brunei was just 0.01% in 2022, reflecting a highly liberal trade policy.

title: Minimal Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: Brunei applied a weighted mean tariff rate of 0.01% on primary products in 2018, showcasing its commitment to free trade in essential goods.

title: Low Agricultural Raw Materials Imports
description: In 2023, agricultural raw materials constituted only 0.07% of Brunei's merchandise imports, indicating a limited dependence on agricultural imports.

title: Low Manufactures Imports
description: Manufactured goods made up 27.11% of Brunei's merchandise imports in 2023, suggesting a relatively low importation of manufactured products.
